level-up.name: tackle
level-up.description:
A physical attack in which the user charges and
slams into the target with its whole body.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: tail-whip
level-up.description:
The user wags its tail cutely, making opposing
Pokémon less wary and lowering their Defense stats.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: splash
level-up.description:
The user just flops and splashes around to no effect
at all...
level-up.effect:
Does nothing.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.

level-up.name: synthesis
level-up.description:
The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP
regained varies with the weather.
level-up.effect:
Heals the user for half its max HP.

During sunny day, the healing is increased to 2/3 max HP.

During hail, rain dance, or sandstorm, the healing is decreased to 1/4 max HP.

level-up.name: tail-whip
level-up.description:
The user wags its tail cutely, making opposing
Pokémon less wary and lowering their Defense stats.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: synthesis

regained varies with the weather.
level-up.effect:
Heals the user for half its max HP.

During sunny day, the healing is increased to 2/3 max HP.

During hail, rain dance, or sandstorm, the healing is decreased to 1/4 max HP.

level-up.name: tackle
level-up.description:
A physical attack in which the user charges and
slams into the target with its whole body.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: poison-powder
level-up.description:
The user scatters a cloud of poisonous dust that
poisons the target.
level-up.effect: Poisons the target.

level-up.name: stun-spore
level-up.description:
The user scatters a cloud of numbing powder that
paralyzes the target.
level-up.effect: Paralyzes the target.

level-up.name: sleep-powder
level-up.description:
The user scatters a big cloud of sleep-inducing dust
around the target.
level-up.effect: Puts the target to sleep.

level-up.name: leech-seed
level-up.description:
A seed is planted on the target. It steals some HP
from the target every turn.
level-up.effect:
Plants a seed on the target that drains 1/8 of its max HP at the end of every turn and heals the user for the amount taken.  Has no effect on grass Pokémon.  The seed remains until the target leaves the field.

The user takes damage instead of being healed if the target has liquid ooze.

rapid spin will remove this effect.

This effect is passed on by baton pass.

level-up.name: cotton-spore
level-up.description:
The user releases cotton-like spores that cling to
opposing Pokémon, which harshly lowers their
Speed stats.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Speed by two stages.

level-up.name: mega-drain
level-up.description:
A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored
by half the damage taken by the target.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

machine.name: headbutt
machine.description:
The user sticks out its head and attacks by charging
straight into the target. This may also make the
target flinch.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: curse
machine.description:
A move that works differently for the Ghost type
than for all other types.
machine.effect:
If the user is a ghost: user pays half its max HP to place a curse on the target, damaging it for 1/4 its max HP every turn.
Otherwise: Lowers the user's Speed by one stage, and raises its Attack and Defense by one stage each.

The curse effect is passed on by baton pass.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

machine.name: flash
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: sunny-day
machine.description:
The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering
up Fire-type moves. It lowers the power of
Water-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects.

Pokémon with flower gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: sweet-scent
machine.description:
A sweet scent that harshly lowers opposing
Pokémon’s evasiveness.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: snore
machine.description:
This attack can be used only if the user is asleep.
The harsh noise may also make the target flinch.
machine.effect: Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: giga-drain
machine.description:
A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored
by half the damage taken by the target.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

machine.name: endure
machine.description:
The user endures any attack with at least 1 HP.
Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
machine.effect:
The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: solar-beam
machine.description:
In this two-turn attack, the user gathers light, then
blasts a bundled beam on the next turn.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User charges for one turn before attacking.

During sunny day, the charge turn is skipped.

During hail, rain dance, or sandstorm, power is halved.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: sleep-talk
machine.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
machine.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

machine.name: defense-curl
machine.description:
The user curls up to conceal weak spots and raise
its Defense stat.
machine.effect:
Raises user's Defense by one stage.

After this move is used, the power of ice ball and rollout are doubled until the user leaves the field.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

tutor.name: swords-dance
tutor.description:
A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit.
This sharply raises the user’s Attack stat.
tutor.effect: Raises the user's Attack by two stages.

tutor.name: double-edge
tutor.description:
A reckless, life-risking tackle in which the user rushes
the target. This also damages the user quite a lot.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

tutor.name: mimic
tutor.description:
The user copies the target’s last move. The move
can be used during battle until the Pokémon is
switched out.
tutor.effect:
This move is replaced by the target's last successfully used move, and its PP changes to 5.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, or if the user already knows the targeted move, this move will fail.  This effect vanishes when the user leaves the field.

If chatter, metronome, mimic, sketch, or struggle is selected, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome, nor forced by encore.

tutor.name: defense-curl
tutor.description:
The user curls up to conceal weak spots and raise
its Defense stat.
tutor.effect:
Raises user's Defense by one stage.

After this move is used, the power of ice ball and rollout are doubled until the user leaves the field.

tutor.name: substitute
tutor.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
tutor.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

level-up.name: tackle
level-up.description:
A physical attack in which the user charges and
slams into the target with its whole body.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: tail-whip
level-up.description:
The user wags its tail cutely, making opposing
Pokémon less wary and lowering their Defense stats.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: splash
level-up.description:
The user just flops and splashes around to no effect
at all...
level-up.effect:
Does nothing.

The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP

During hail, rain dance, or sandstorm, the healing is decreased to 1/4 max HP.

level-up.description:
A seed is planted on the target. It steals some HP
from the target every turn.

Plants a seed on the target that drains 1/8 of its max HP at the end of every turn and heals the user for the amount taken.  Has no effect on grass Pokémon.  The seed remains until the target leaves the field.

The user takes damage instead of being healed if the target has liquid ooze.

rapid spin will remove this effect.

This effect is passed on by baton pass.

level-up.name: mega-drain
level-up.description:
A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored
by half the damage taken by the target.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

level-up.description:
The user releases cotton-like spores that cling to
opposing Pokémon, which harshly lowers their
Speed stats.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Speed by two stages.

level-up.name: u-turn
level-up.description:
After making its attack, the user rushes back to
switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faints from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

level-up.name: bounce
level-up.description:
The user bounces up high, then drops on the target
on the second turn. This may also leave the target
with paralysis.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User bounces high into the air for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

During the immune turn, gust, hurricane, sky uppercut, smack down, thunder, and twister still hit the user normally.  gust and twister also have double power against the user.

The damage from hail and sandstorm still applies during the immune turn.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

level-up.name: memento

The user faints when using this move. In return, this
harshly lowers the target’s Attack and Sp. Atk stats.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Attack and Special Attack by two stages.  User faints.

machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: bullet-seed

The user forcefully shoots seeds at the target two
to five times in a row.

Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: sunny-day
machine.description:
The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering
up Fire-type moves. It lowers the power of
Water-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects.

Pokémon with flower gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

machine.name: sleep-talk
machine.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
machine.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

machine.name: natural-gift
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held berry.  The berry is consumed.  If the user is not holding a berry, this move will fail.

machine.name: grass-knot
machine.description:
The user snares the target with grass and trips it.
The heavier the target, the greater the
move’s power.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: u-turn
machine.description:
After making its attack, the user rushes back to
switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faints from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

level-up.description:
The user bounces up high, then drops on the target
on the second turn. This may also leave the target
with paralysis.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User bounces high into the air for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

During the immune turn, gust, hurricane, sky uppercut, smack down, thunder, and twister still hit the user normally.  gust and twister also have double power against the user.

The damage from hail and sandstorm still applies during the immune turn.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

level-up.name: memento
level-up.description:
The user faints when using this move. In return, this
harshly lowers the target’s Attack and Sp. Atk stats.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Attack and Special Attack by two stages.  User faints.

tutor.name: snore
tutor.description:
This attack can be used only if the user is asleep.
The harsh noise may also make the target flinch.
tutor.effect: Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

tutor.name: giga-drain
tutor.description:
A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored
by half the damage taken by the target.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

tutor.name: sleep-talk
tutor.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
tutor.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

tutor.name: synthesis
tutor.description:
The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP
regained varies with the weather.
tutor.effect:
Heals the user for half its max HP.

During sunny day, the healing is increased to 2/3 max HP.

During hail, rain dance, or sandstorm, the healing is decreased to 1/4 max HP.

tutor.name: helping-hand
tutor.description:
The user assists an ally by boosting the power of
that ally’s attack.
tutor.effect:
Boosts the power of the target's moves by 50% until the end of this turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

tutor.name: bounce
tutor.description:
The user bounces up high, then drops on the target
on the second turn. This may also leave the target
with paralysis.
tutor.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User bounces high into the air for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

During the immune turn, gust, hurricane, sky uppercut, smack down, thunder, and twister still hit the user normally.  gust and twister also have double power against the user.

The damage from hail and sandstorm still applies during the immune turn.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

tutor.name: worry-seed
tutor.description:
A seed that causes worry is planted on the target.
It prevents sleep by making the target’s
Ability Insomnia.
tutor.effect:
Changes the target's ability to insomnia.

If the target's ability is truant or multitype, this move will fail.

tutor.name: seed-bomb
tutor.description:
The user slams a barrage of hard-shelled seeds
down on the target from above.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: sunny-day
machine.description:
The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering
up Fire-type moves. It lowers the power of
Water-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects.

Pokémon with flower gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: solar-beam
machine.description:
In this two-turn attack, the user gathers light, then
blasts a bundled beam on the next turn.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User charges for one turn before attacking.

During sunny day, the charge turn is skipped.

During hail, rain dance, or sandstorm, power is halved.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: reflect
machine.description:
A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage
from physical attacks for five turns.
machine.effect:
Erects a barrier around the user's side of the field that reduces damage from physical attacks by half for five turns.  In double battles, the reduction is 1/3.  Critical hits are not affected by the barrier.

If the user is holding light clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.

brick break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.

machine.name: aerial-ace
machine.description:
The user confounds the target with speed, then
slashes. This attack never misses.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

machine.name: facade
machine.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: round
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with a song. Others can
join in the Round to increase the power of
the attack.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: energy-ball
machine.description:
The user draws power from nature and fires it at the
target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: acrobatics
machine.description:
The user nimbly strikes the target. If the user is not
holding an item, this attack inflicts massive damage.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user has no held item, this move has double power.

machine.name: flash
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.

machine.name: swords-dance
machine.description:
A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit.
This sharply raises the user’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Attack by two stages.

machine.name: psych-up
machine.description:
The user hypnotizes itself into copying any stat
change made by the target.
machine.effect:
Discards the user's stat changes and copies the target's.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

machine.name: grass-knot
machine.description:
The user snares the target with grass and trips it.
The heavier the target, the greater the
move’s power.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: u-turn
machine.description:
After making its attack, the user rushes back to
switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faints from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

level-up.name: tackle
level-up.description:
A physical attack in which the user charges and
slams into the target with its whole body.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: tail-whip
level-up.description:
The user wags its tail cutely, making opposing
Pokémon less wary and lowering their Defense stats.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: splash
level-up.description:
The user just flops and splashes around to no effect
at all...
level-up.effect:
Does nothing.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.

level-up.effect:

The user scatters a big cloud of sleep-inducing dust

level-up.effect: Puts the target to sleep.

level-up.name: bullet-seed
level-up.description:
The user forcefully shoots seeds at the target two
to five times in a row.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

level-up.name: leech-seed
level-up.description:
A seed is planted on the target. It steals some HP
from the target every turn.
level-up.effect:
Plants a seed on the target that drains 1/8 of its max HP at the end of every turn and heals the user for the amount taken.  Has no effect on grass Pokémon.  The seed remains until the target leaves the field.

The user takes damage instead of being healed if the target has liquid ooze.

rapid spin will remove this effect.

This effect is passed on by baton pass.

level-up.name: rage-powder
level-up.description:
The user scatters a cloud of irritating powder to
draw attention to itself. Opposing Pokémon aim only at
the user.
level-up.effect:
Until the end of this turn, any moves that opposing Pokémon target solely at the user's ally will instead target the user.  If both Pokémon on the same side of the field use this move on the same turn, the Pokémon that uses it last will become the target.

This effect takes priority over lightning rod and storm drain.

If the user's ally switches out, opposing Pokémon may still hit it with pursuit.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: round
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with a song. Others can
join in the Round to increase the power of
the attack.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: energy-ball
machine.description:
The user draws power from nature and fires it at the
target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: acrobatics
machine.description:
The user nimbly strikes the target. If the user is not
holding an item, this attack inflicts massive damage.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user has no held item, this move has double power.

machine.name: flash
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.

machine.name: swords-dance
machine.description:
A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit.
This sharply raises the user’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Attack by two stages.

machine.name: psych-up
machine.description:
The user hypnotizes itself into copying any stat
change made by the target.
machine.effect:
Discards the user's stat changes and copies the target's.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

machine.name: infestation
machine.description:
The target is infested and attacked for four to five
turns. The target can’t flee during this time.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  For the next 2–5 turns, the target cannot leave the field and is damaged for 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.  The user continues to use other moves during this time.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

rapid spin cancels this effect.

machine.name: grass-knot
machine.description:
The user snares the target with grass and trips it.
The heavier the target, the greater the
move’s power.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: sleep-talk
machine.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
machine.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

machine.name: u-turn
machine.description:
After making its attack, the user rushes back to
switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faints from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

machine.name: dazzling-gleam
machine.description:
The user damages opposing Pokémon by emitting a
powerful flash.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: confide
machine.description:
The user tells the target a secret, and the target
loses its ability to concentrate. This lowers
the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.

level-up.name: tail-whip
level-up.description:
The user wags its tail cutely, making opposing
Pokémon less wary and lowering their Defense stats.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: absorb
level-up.description:
A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored
by half the damage taken by the target.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

level-up.name: splash
level-up.description:
The user just flops and splashes around to no effect
at all...
level-up.effect:
Does nothing.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.

level-up.name: synthesis
level-up.description:
The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP
regained varies with the weather.
level-up.effect:
Heals the user for half its max HP.

During sunny day, the healing is increased to 2/3 max HP.

During hail, rain dance, or sandstorm, the healing is decreased to 1/4 max HP.

level-up.name: synthesis
level-up.description:
The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP
regained varies with the weather.
level-up.effect:
Heals the user for half its max HP.

During sunny day, the healing is increased to 2/3 max HP.

During hail, rain dance, or sandstorm, the healing is decreased to 1/4 max HP.

level-up.name: tail-whip
level-up.description:
The user wags its tail cutely, making opposing
Pokémon less wary and lowering their Defense stats.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: tackle
level-up.description:
A physical attack in which the user charges and
slams into the target with its whole body.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: fairy-wind
level-up.description:
The user stirs up a fairy wind and strikes the target
with it.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: poison-powder
level-up.description:
The user scatters a cloud of poisonous dust that
poisons the target.
level-up.effect: Poisons the target.

level-up.name: stun-spore
level-up.description:
The user scatters a cloud of numbing powder that
paralyzes the target.
level-up.effect: Paralyzes the target.

level-up.name: sleep-powder
level-up.description:
The user scatters a big cloud of sleep-inducing dust
around the target.
level-up.effect: Puts the target to sleep.

level-up.name: bullet-seed
level-up.description:
The user forcefully shoots seeds at the target two
to five times in a row.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

level-up.name: leech-seed
level-up.description:
A seed is planted on the target. It steals some HP
from the target every turn.
level-up.effect:
Plants a seed on the target that drains 1/8 of its max HP at the end of every turn and heals the user for the amount taken.  Has no effect on grass Pokémon.  The seed remains until the target leaves the field.

The user takes damage instead of being healed if the target has liquid ooze.

rapid spin will remove this effect.

This effect is passed on by baton pass.

level-up.name: mega-drain
level-up.description:
A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored
by half the damage taken by the target.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

level-up.name: acrobatics
level-up.description:
The user nimbly strikes the target. If the user is not
holding an item, this attack inflicts massive damage.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user has no held item, this move has double power.

level-up.name: rage-powder
level-up.description:
The user scatters a cloud of irritating powder to
draw attention to itself. Opposing Pokémon aim only at
the user.
level-up.effect:
Until the end of this turn, any moves that opposing Pokémon target solely at the user's ally will instead target the user.  If both Pokémon on the same side of the field use this move on the same turn, the Pokémon that uses it last will become the target.

This effect takes priority over lightning rod and storm drain.

If the user's ally switches out, opposing Pokémon may still hit it with pursuit.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

level-up.name: cotton-spore
level-up.description:
The user releases cotton-like spores that cling to
opposing Pokémon, which harshly lowers their
Speed stats.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Speed by two stages.

level-up.name: u-turn
level-up.description:
After making its attack, the user rushes back to
switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faints from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

level-up.name: worry-seed
level-up.description:
A seed that causes worry is planted on the target.
It prevents sleep by making the target’s
Ability Insomnia.
level-up.effect:
Changes the target's ability to insomnia.

If the target's ability is truant or multitype, this move will fail.

level-up.name: giga-drain
level-up.description:
A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored
by half the damage taken by the target.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

level-up.name: bounce
level-up.description:
The user bounces up high, then drops on the target
on the second turn. This may also leave the target
with paralysis.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User bounces high into the air for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

During the immune turn, gust, hurricane, sky uppercut, smack down, thunder, and twister still hit the user normally.  gust and twister also have double power against the user.

The damage from hail and sandstorm still applies during the immune turn.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

level-up.name: memento
level-up.description:
The user faints when using this move. In return, this
harshly lowers the target’s Attack and Sp. Atk stats.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Attack and Special Attack by two stages.  User faints.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: sunny-day
machine.description:
The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering
up Fire-type moves. It lowers the power of
Water-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects.

Pokémon with flower gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: solar-beam
machine.description:
In this two-turn attack, the user gathers light, then
blasts a bundled beam on the next turn.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User charges for one turn before attacking.

During sunny day, the charge turn is skipped.

During hail, rain dance, or sandstorm, power is halved.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: reflect
machine.description:
A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage
from physical attacks for five turns.
machine.effect:
Erects a barrier around the user's side of the field that reduces damage from physical attacks by half for five turns.  In double battles, the reduction is 1/3.  Critical hits are not affected by the barrier.

If the user is holding light clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.

brick break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.

machine.name: aerial-ace
machine.description:
The user confounds the target with speed, then
slashes. This attack never misses.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
